page.title: 18INTERESTING THINGS TO SEE
page.content: TOURISM - THERE ARE MANY INTERESTING THINGS TO BE SEEN IN THIS AREA RANGING FROM THE REMAINS OF AN OLD RAILWAY LINE, A WATER TREATMENT WORKS, THE OLD TOLLGATE COTTAGE, THE DRAW-OFF POINT FOR WATER FROM THE RIVER NENE, SEVERAL CIRCULAR SPINNEYS - CHARACTERISTIC OF THE AREA -, TO AN OLD STONE MONUMENT ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF PITSFORD VILLAGE. IT IS POSSIBLE TO VISIT AND TOUR THE WATER TREATMENT WORKS BY ARRANGEMENT WITH THE "ANGLIA WATER AUTHORITY". THE LEVEL OF WATER IN THE RESERVOIR IS REPLENISHED WHEN NECESSARY BY DRAWING FROM THE RIVER AT "MERRY TOM" AND PUMPING TO PITSFORD. THE CIRCULAR SPINNEYS MAY BE SEEN AS FREQUENT FEATURES ON EARL SPENCER'S LAND. I UNDERSTAND THAT THEIR MAIN FUNCTION IS TO PROVIDE SHELTERED REARING CONDITIONS FOR PHEASANTS WHICH LOCAL GENTRY MAY THEN SHOOT IN SEASON.
